briefdescription.para: Allocate a buffer that holds at least nitems of size sizeof_item.

detaileddescription.para: The total size of the buffer will be rounded up to a system dependent boundary. This is typically the system page size, but under MS windows is 64KB.

parameterdescription.para: is the minimum number of items the buffer will hold.
is the size of an item in bytes.
is the block that writes to this buffer.

memberdef.argsstring: (buffer_sptr buf, int nzero_preload, block_sptr link, int delay)
memberdef.name: buffer_add_reader

briefdescription.para: Create a new gr::buffer_reader and attach it to buffer buf.

parameterdescription.para: is the buffer the gr::buffer_reader reads from.
number of zero items to "preload" into buffer.
is the block that reads from the buffer using this gr::buffer_reader.
Optional setting to declare the buffer's sample delay.

briefdescription.para: return number of items worth of space available for writing
return size of this buffer in items
return the base address of the buffer

detaileddescription.para: The return value points at space that can hold at least space_available() items.

briefdescription.para: tell buffer that we wrote nitems into it
Return the block that writes to this buffer.
Adds a new tag to the buffer.
Removes an existing tag from the buffer.

detaileddescription.para: If no such tag is found, does nothing. Note: Doesn't actually physically delete the tag, but marks it as deleted. For the user, this has the same effect: Any subsequent calls to get_tags_in_range() will not return the tag.

parameterdescription.para: the tag that needs to be removed
the unique ID of the block calling this function

briefdescription.para: Removes all tags before max_time from buffer.

parameterdescription.para: the time (item number) to trim up until.

briefdescription.para: constructor is private. Use gr_make_buffer to create instances.

detaileddescription.para: Allocate a buffer that holds at least nitems of size sizeof_item.

nitems
is the minimum number of items the buffer will hold.
sizeof_item
is the size of an item in bytes.
link
is the block that writes to this buffer.
The total size of the buffer will be rounded up to a system dependent boundary. This is typically the system page size, but under MS windows is 64KB.
